data: Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Immediate Post Operative phase. These orders continue on the inpatient unit
Discontinue ORTHO Elective - Pre-Operative (Day of Surgery) Powerplan
Avoid catheter unless one or more indicators met:  - Retention not relieved by 2 in and out catheters  - Severe pain unrelieved with analgesics
If no catheter in situ or post catheter removal, assess patient for ability to void q6h using bladder scanner.
If unable to void, bladder discomfort or voiding small amounts, bladder scan
If PVR greater than 300 mL, perform straight intermittent catheterization x 3 PRN. If third catheterization is required, inform MD / NP
If PVR greater than 500 mL, perform straight intermittent catheterization x 3 PRN. If third catheterization is required, inform MD / NP
On arrival to unit, then q4h for 48 hour,  then q8h for 48 hour, then BID until discharge
Q2h for 12 hours, then q4h x 36 hours, then q12h x 48 hours, then PRN only
On arrival to unit, then q4h for 48 hour, then q8h for 48 hour, then q12h until discharge
On arrival to unit, then q4h for 48 hour,  then q8h for 48 hour, then BID until discharge
Q2h for 12 hours, then q4h x 36 hours, then q12h x 48 hours, then PRN only
On arrival to unit, then q4h for 48 hour, then q8h for 48 hour, then q12h until discharge
For compartment syndrome assessment with pain, q1h x 12 hours, then q2h x 12 hours. Increase frequency of monitoring as required
For compartment syndrome assessment with pain, q2h x 12 hours, then q4h x 36 hours. Then PRN only. Increase frequency of monitoring as required
On arrival to unit, then q4h for 48 hour,  then q8h for 48 hour, then BID until discharge
Site: Surgical incision(s), Reinforce PRN, If saturated
T+2;N, Site: Surgical incision(s), Leave dressings to primary closed wounds for 48 hours, then PRN
Site: Surgical incision(s), Do not change dressing until seen by surgeon
T;N+480, When drainage is less than 30 mL in 8 hours. If criterion not met within 48 hours, notify treating provider
T;N+480, When drainage is less than 30 mL in 8 hours. If criterion not met within 48 hours, notify treating provider
T+10;N, Remove suture(s) post-op day 10-14 (if still in hospital)
T+10;N, Remove staple(s) post-op day 10-14 (if still in hospital)
Left upper extremity, full weight-bearing, As tolerated
Left upper extremity, full weight-bearing, With a forearm walker
Right upper extremity, full weight-bearing, As tolerated
Right upper extremity, full weight-bearing, With forearm walker
Other (please specify), No pushing, pulling and/or lifting
Other (please specify), Pushing, pulling and/or lifting restricting to 5-10 lbs
Other (please specify), Unrestricted pushing, pulling and/or lifting restricting
Hand, wrist and elbow motion as tolerated only. No shoulder motion
Active-assisted and passive ROM only. Maximal 100 Deg of flexion elevation and 20 Deg of external rotation

For PT/OT, 0 Degrees is with the elbow straight
Other (please specify), Ligament Stability: All Stable
Other (please specify), Lateral Collateral Ligament Protocol,  Rehabilitation: Safe Exercise Range of Motion: Lateral Collateral Ligament Protocol: AROM/AAROM Flexion/Extension in forearm pronation
Other (please specify), Medial Collateral Ligament Protocol,  Rehabilitation: Safe Exercise Range of Motion: Medial Collateral Ligament Protocol: AROM/AAROM Flexion/Extension in forearm supination
Other (please specify), Neutral Protocol, Rehabilitation: Safe Exercise Range of Motion: Neutral Protocol: AROM/AAROM Flexion/Extension in neutral forearm rotation

Other (please specify), Triceps Deficient Protocol, Rehabilitation: Safe Exercise Range of Motion: Triceps Deficient Protocol: Starting 3 weeks post repair, increase extension by 10 Deg/week (turn buckle brace). At _____ weeks begin AROM elbow extension

Other (please specify), Muscle Integrity: Biceps Disruption

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
1,000 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 3 doses or times, drug form: bag
2,000 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 3 doses or times, drug form: bag
1,000 mg, IV, q12h, order duration: 24 hour
1,500 mg, IV, q12h, order duration: 24 hour
If ceFAZolin allergic or contraindicated, select vancomycin or clindamycin
150 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab
40 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
Insulin Subcutaneous for Patients Eating or NPO (Sliding Scale) (Module)
Insulin Subcutaneous for Patients on TPN or Continuous Enteral Feeds (Sliding Scale) (Module)

For a new fever greater than 38.5 DegC
Deep breathing and coughing exercises as per guideline, if applicable
Q4h while on opioids. Withhold opioid analgesia if sedation scale greater than 2. If sedation scale greater than 2 and/or respiratory rate less than 8/min, HOLD narcotics and notify provider urgently
For patients with circumferential dressing/cast, if uncontrolled or persistent pain, split dressing or cast and notify surgeon/NP
q12h, If CAM positive and medication provided, notify MD/NP to investigate underlying cause within 24 hours during working hours
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order

Start: Full Fluid Diet, Advance/Adjust to: General Diet
